reasoning: Varicosity (varicose veins) is a chronic venous disorder appropriately measured by prevalence rather than incidence. Global prevalence estimated at approximately 15% (15,000 per 100k) based on epidemiological literature, with substantial geographic variation.
source: Evans CJ et al. (2011). Epidemiology and etiology of varicose veins. Phlebology. 26(8):335-341
